object.name: blackberry.invoke
object.comment: The Invoke object contains methods that interact with other applications on a BlackBerry PlayBook.
object.example:
<script type="text/javascript">  

	function startCameraApp() {
		var args = new blackberry.invoke.CameraArguments();
		args.view = blackberry.invoke.CameraArguments.VIEW_RECORDER;
  
  
		blackberry.invoke.invoke(blackberry.invoke.APP_CAMERA, args);
	}
	
	startCameraApp();
      
</script>

func.name: invoke
func.comment: Invokes another application on the BlackBerry PlayBook.

param.name: appType
param.comment: An integer value representing the type of application to launch. Must be one of the 'APP_*' constants.

param.name: args
param.comment: An arguments object specifying information for the application being invoked.

func.details: Throws an Exception if values supplied are not correct.

object.name: blackberry.invoke.CameraArguments
object.comment: The CameraArguments object is an instance object, and is used as a parameter to the invoke() method when invoking the Camera application or Recorder application.
object.details: The CameraArguments object must be created as an instance using the new keyword.

property.name: view
property.comment: Value that specifies what kind of camera application you want to open.

ctor.comment: Constructor for a new CameraArguments object.

object.name: blackberry.invoke.BrowserArguments
object.comment: The BrowserArguments object is an instance object, and is used as a parameter to the invoke() method when invoking the BlackBerry Browser application.
object.details: The BrowserArguments object must be created as an instance using the new keyword.

property.name: url
property.comment: The desired url to load in the browser.

ctor.comment: Open Browser application on the BlackBerry PlayBook.

param.name: url
param.comment: The desired url to load in the browser.

ctor.details: Throws an Exception if values supplied are not correct.
